japanese:
らいはちゃん、楽しそうでよかったですね。
あなたも、いつまでも立っていないで
こちらに座ってはどうですか？
translation:
Raiha-chan looks like she's having so much fun.
Uesugi-kun, if you don't want to keep standing there,
you can sit here, okay?

japanese: ん？　いいのか？
translation: Hm? Is that alright?

japanese:
フー君の場所はちゃんと空けてあるんだから。
遠慮なんてしてないで来なさいよ。
translation:
We've got a seat for you right here, Fu-kun.
Don't be shy, come here.

japanese: じゃあ、ちょっと休ませてもらうか。
translation: Okay, I might rest for a bit.

japanese: やったわ！
translation: Yay!

japanese: ん？　なんだ？
translation: Hm? What?

japanese:
ううん、なんでもない。
それより、こんなロマンチックな夜に
フー君と一緒に流れ星を見れるなんて……。
translation:
Oh, don't mind me.
Ahh, to be able to watch shooting stars with you,
Fu-kun, during a romantic night like this...

japanese:
俺も、お前たちに流星群を見せてやれて一安心だ。
ここじゃ娯楽になるようなものも少ないしな。
今日のところはこれで我慢してくれ。
translation:
I'm relieved I could show you all the meteor shower.
There aren't many entertaining things here.
Please just be satisfied with this for today.

japanese:
充分よ。
フー君が、私たちのワガママを
ちゃんと叶えてくれたんだもの。
translation:
This is totally enough.
Fu-kun, you really listened to what we wanted.

japanese:
今までは、日々の生活で手一杯で
こうして夜空を見上げようなんて
考えもしませんでした。
translation:
Until now, I had never thought of looking up
at the night sky like this because I was so busy with my daily life.

japanese:
あっ、見てください！
流星群にばかり目を奪われていましたが
天の川も見事ですよ。
translation:
Oh, look!
We've been so mesmerized by the meteor shower,
but the Milky Way is also stunning.

japanese:
夏の天体観測で天の川とくれば、
やはり大三角は外せないな。
translation:
When it comes to the Milky Way during summer stargazing, 
you can't leave out the Summer Triangle.

japanese: 大三角？
translation: The Summer Triangle?

japanese:
あ、夏の大三角形ですね？
知ってはいますが、どこにあるのかまでは……。
translation:
Oh, the Great Summer Triangle, right?
I've heard of it,
but I don't know where it is...

japanese:
夏の星座の中じゃ有名だぞ？
七夕の話は聞いたことがあるだろ？
translation:
It's famous among the summer constellations.
You've heard of the Tanabata star festival before, haven't you?

japanese:
もちろんよ。
１年に１回、七夕の日に織姫と彦星が
天の川を渡ってデートする話ね。
translation:
Of course. It's the story of Orihime and Hikoboshi 
crossing the Milky Way once a year on 
the day of the star festival to meet.

japanese:
あー、まあ、だいたいそんな話とも言えるか。
どっちの星も天の川をたどっていけば
簡単に見つけられるぞ。
translation:
Ahh, well, that's about how the story goes.
Both stars are easy to find by following the Milky Way.

japanese:
織姫はこと座のベガ。
あそこで大きく光ってる星だな。
別名は織女星だ。
translation:
Orihime is Vega, in the Lyra constellation.
It's that big star shining over there.
It's also called the Weaver Star.

japanese:
あったわ！
あの一番輝いてる星が織姫なのね。
translation:
There it is!
So that star shining the brightest is Orihime, right?

japanese:
そして、天の川の対岸側で光っているのが
わし座のアルタイル、彦星だ。
牽牛星とも言うから覚えておけ。
translation:
And shining on the other side of the Milky Way
is Altair in the constellation Aquila, or Hikoboshi.
It's also called the Cowherd Star. Don't forget.

japanese:
見つけました。
彦星のほうが少し暗いのですね。
translation:
I found it.
Hikoboshi is a little dimmer, huh.

japanese:
２人のあいだに天の川があるせいで
七夕の日にしか会えないなんて可哀想ね。
translation:
It really is tragic that they can only meet during 
Tanabata because the Milky Way separates them.

japanese:
でも、会える日を夢見て
燃え上がる想いを募らせる……！
そう思えばロマンチックだわ。
translation:
But their passionate feelings grow as they dream of the day
they can once again meet...!
It's so romantic when you think about it.

japanese:
そうでしょうか？
そもそも恋にうつつを抜かして
働かなくなった罰として引き離されたのでしょう？
translation:
I wonder? Weren't they separated as punishment
for not working because they were
so blinded by love in the first place?

japanese: となると、自業自得なのでは？
translation: So, perhaps they got their just deserts?

japanese: デネブだけ仲間はずれだな。
translation: Only Deneb is left out, huh.

japanese: デネブ？
translation: Deneb?

japanese: なんのことですか？
translation: What do you mean?

japanese:
あのなぁ、少しは自分で考えてみろ。
夏の大三角って言うからには、
もう１つ星があるって見当がつかないか？
translation:
Well come on, think about it yourself for a bit.
If we call it the Great Summer Triangle,
there's gotta be one more star, right?

japanese:
ああ、そうよね。
それがデネブなのね。
translation:
Ah, I see.
That's Deneb, huh?

japanese: その星は、七夕の伝説には登場しないのですか？
translation:
That star doesn't make an appearance
in the Tanabata legend?

japanese:
一応、織姫と彦星が天の川を渡るとき、
橋代わりをしたカササギって鳥だという説があるな。
翼を広げて橋になった、と言われてる。
translation:
There is a theory that magpie birds spread their wings and
take on the form of a bridge whenever Orihime and Hikoboshi
cross the Milky Way. Or so they say.

japanese: ああ、それでデネブは天の川の中に見えるのですね。
translation:
I see, so that's why we can see Deneb
in the middle of the Milky Way.

japanese:
ふうん、翼の橋を渡って会いに行くなんて、
ますますロマンチックじゃない。
translation:
Oooh, crossing a bridge made of wings to meet someone
makes it sound more and more romantic.

japanese:
まあ、今年の七夕はもうすぎちまったし、
彦星と織姫が会うのは来年までお預けだな。
translation:
Well, this year's Tanabata has already passed, so
Hikoboshi and Orihime will have to wait till next year.

japanese: 七夕の日は雨が降らないといいな。
translation: I hope rain doesn't fall on Tanabata.

japanese:
年に一度だけの、大切な人と過ごせる時間だもの。
そのくらいは神様も気を利かせるべきね。
translation:
It's the only time once a year to spend with your loved one. 
The gods should at least be a little considerate, right?

japanese: でも、もし私が織姫なら雨でも構わないわ。
translation:
However, if I were Orihime,
I wouldn't mind if it rained.

japanese: 天の川があふれちまうのにか？
translation: Even if the Milky Way flooded?

japanese:
ええ、その程度じゃ、１年分の想いを
止めることなんてできないわよ。
そうねぇ、神様に川を静かにさせようかしら？
translation:
That wouldn't stop my year's worth of longing
for Hikoboshi.
I'd make the gods quiet the river.

japanese:
神様を使う織姫かよ。
話がめちゃくちゃに……。
translation:
An Orihime that uses the gods?
This conversation has gone off the rails...

japanese:
まあ、今年の七夕はもうすぎちまったし、
彦星と織姫が会うのは来年までお預けだな。
translation:
Well, this year's Tanabata has already passed, so
Hikoboshi and Orihime will have to wait till next year.

japanese:
自制が大事ってことだ。
何事においてもな。
translation:
Self-control is important, eh.
No matter what it's about.

japanese:
教訓としてはその通りですね。
何事も行きすぎず、周囲に迷惑をかけない行動を
心掛けるのが大切です。
translation:
Isn't that the lesson though? 
That it's important to restrain yourself from causing 
trouble to those around you.

japanese: 特に、この島にいる間はな。
translation: Especially while we're on this island.

japanese:
珍しいですね、あなたと意見が合うなんて。
流れ星が落ちてきたりしなければいいのですが。
translation:
It's rare that we actually agree on something. 
I hope that no shooting stars fall on us.

japanese:
それは困ったなぁ。
いくらなんでも、隕石落下から
お前たちを助けてやれる自信はないぜ。
translation:
That's a problem.
I'm not confident I could save you
from a falling meteorite.

japanese:
そもそも、ここに流れ星が落ちる確率なんて
天文学的な低さでもあるが。
translation:
The probability of a shooting star falling to Earth
is astronomically low to begin with, though.

japanese:
ふふ、そうですね。
あなたと意見が合う確率よりも低そうです。
translation:
Heheh, that's right. 
It might be even lower than the fact that we agree.

japanese:
まあ、今年の七夕はもうすぎちまったし、
彦星と織姫が会うのは来年までお預けだな。
translation:
Well, this year's Tanabata has already passed, so
Hikoboshi and Orihime will have to wait till next year.

japanese:
織姫も彦星も、年に一度の日のために
今はお仕事を頑張っているのでしょう。
そういう運命なのですから。
translation:
Orihime and Hikoboshi both must be working
hard now for their once a year day.
Because that's what is destined to be.

japanese:
というか、考えてみたら
そんな運命に従う必要あるのかしら。
translation:
Actually, now that I think about it, 
do they really have to follow such a fate?

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
大好きな人に会うためなら、
天の川を越える方法くらい見つけ出すわ。
私ならね。
translation:
If I wanted to meet the person I love,
I'd think of a way to cross the Milky Way.

japanese: に、二乃らしい考え方ですね……。
translation: Th-that's so you, Nino...

japanese: 伝説が変わっちまうな……。
translation: So this is how legends change...
